lines.text: This is for "mama and the kids."

lines.speaker: u8281
lines.text: What about me?

lines.speaker: u8279
lines.text: You get your money from your husband.

lines.speaker: u8280
lines.text: And here is Three Tree Mesa -- and here I go out of the big arroyo --

lines.speaker: u8285
lines.text: That's the place: I remember - My feet were so darn sore, I couldn't make it -- and Galbraith went on up to the head of the canyon by himself --

lines.speaker: u8281
lines.text: See you tomorrow -

lines.speaker: u8287
lines.text: Tomorrow -

lines.speaker: u8289
lines.text: Love is different for different people.

lines.speaker: u8282
lines.text: I suppose so. I suppose it will be different for us, too  when everyone knows. Then we will be just like other people.  But these last weeks will always be our secret  a lovely secret to remember all our lives.

lines.speaker: u8283
lines.text: Oh, Mr. Galbraith! I'm so glad you're here.

lines.speaker: u8284
lines.text: Good evening.

lines.speaker: u8283
lines.text: You know all about these things - - and I've lived here all my life - and I still don't know what the Procession means.

lines.speaker: u8284
lines.text: It's to remind people of the great tragedy that took place here so that they won't ever forget that a peaceful village of Indians was wiped out by the Conquistadores, back in the 17th Century... A band of monks buried the dead and prayed for them and did penance for their deaths  that's what this procession is supposed to be.

lines.speaker: u8283
lines.text: Oh, that's so interesting!

lines.speaker: u8284
lines.text: Well, now that you've had your history lesson, I think I'll get on to the museum.

lines.speaker: u8284
lines.text: Wait 

lines.speaker: u8286
lines.text: No - really, I can see them -- they're coming now - turn off the lights 

lines.speaker: u8286
lines.text: It's a lovely town - it was until we came and let the leopard loose and all this happened.

lines.speaker: u8285
lines.text: Kiki, Galbraith said something to me once, -- something you ought to know. We were talking and he said that people were like that ball on the fountain at the hotel --they got pushed around by things bigger than themselves. That's the way it was with us -- and we were too small to see it that way.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Hot...  These roads all round here, closed to the public... Whys that? Military bases?  Huh. I guess theres space enough for war games... Must be good for business.

lines.speaker: u8290
lines.text: Must it?

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: All those soldiers out there... getting bored, thirsty. Come out here for refreshment or female company perhaps?

lines.speaker: u8290
lines.text: Aint nobody out there, Mister.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Nobody? Huh!... How come?

lines.speaker: u8290
lines.text: Maybe for the same reason that made someone somewhere not consider this a spot to build the Getty Museum...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Ha-ha... Yeah...  What about that road back there, though? It says closed to the public, doesnt it?

lines.speaker: u8290
lines.text: You a tourist?

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Mrs De Moraes must have taken it hard, eh?  Her brothers death.

lines.speaker: u8291
lines.text: Dial O-O-O on the telephone if you change your mind about the drink, sir.

lines.speaker: u8292
lines.text: I... We have to bury Leon tommorrow...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: The dead can wait.

lines.speaker: u8293
lines.text: Theres nothing wrong with the line, sir. Are you sure you have the right number? 770 471 is the number of a call box.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: A call box? Thats odd. Where exactly?

lines.speaker: u8293
lines.text: Penrhyndeudraeth, North Wales.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Can you tell me how you spell...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: The word for those things is croissants.

lines.speaker: u8294
lines.text: Not in America, sir. You must be from Europe.  So, black coffee and a couple of crescents.

lines.speaker: u8295
lines.text: Shit! Fuck! Whats fucking wrong with people!  Im going to bed. And sweet dreams to you to!

lines.speaker: u8314
lines.text: Shell be alright. Shes tough...

lines.speaker: u8296
lines.text: What sort of puppy are you looking for?

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: What sort have you got?

lines.speaker: u8296
lines.text: Pups. Bitches. From three to twelve months.  Trained and untrained ones. White and brown ones. You understand?

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u8296
lines.text: We also provide 24-hour after-sale service. Were the puppy to fall sick or accidently die, we would unburden you, you understand?

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Yes... Good, good...

lines.speaker: u8296
lines.text: So, what are you looking for?

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: What about an untrained pup, white...

lines.speaker: u8296
lines.text: How much of a hurry are you in?

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Tomorrow?

lines.speaker: u8296
lines.text: Im afraid the only pups currently available at such notice are brown and trained. But they are all very cheerful and have been thoroughly checked for diseases...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: I see. How much?

lines.speaker: u8296
lines.text: Fifteen for a straight delivery. Twenty with the provision of a safe place. Visitors tend to find the second option more convenient.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: ... Fine. Ill go for the safe place.

lines.speaker: u8296
lines.text: Have the money ready by 11am. Well call you.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: What colour is your car?  What colour is your car?

lines.speaker: u8297
lines.text: B-Black...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Where is it?

lines.speaker: u8297
lines.text: Downstairs... At the front... Jesus...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: You sure you passed on my message?

lines.speaker: u8298
lines.text: I certainly did, sir...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Hello, Jane. Its me.

lines.speaker: u8299
lines.text: Really? And how are you, eh?  Someone called Pierre Dreyer said that a month ago he had dinner with a Brazilian friend of...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Carlos De Moraes?

lines.speaker: u8299
lines.text: Yes. How did...

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Thank you, Jane.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Moreau? Cest moi. Alors...

lines.speaker: u8305
lines.text: Salut, Laurent. Ouais. It wasnt easy but I got what you wanted through Interpol. Say, whats your business with these Spitzes?

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: They lost their son. Why?

lines.speaker: u8305
lines.text: It appears that in their younger days they were actively involved with a shady German group of Nazi hunters known as Never Forget. Over the years were talking about a dozen or so execution-type killings.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Are they still operative?

lines.speaker: u8305
lines.text: Their last suspected kill occurred two years back, though your Spitzes now probably do no more than bankroll the group. Still, Id watch my step. These people are well-connected, Laurent; former Israeli prime minister, etc. The ladys also president of an international Zionist organisation... Anyway, you get the picture.

lines.speaker: u8300
lines.text: Mossad?

lines.speaker: u8305
lines.text: Its a good guess...

lines.speaker: u8301
lines.text: Ha ha... Yes. With prices reaching an all time low, the name of the game has become have-it- where-its-at... As we all know, transportation has always been the costliest and trickiest part of this business...

lines.speaker: u8302
lines.text: Cost what?

lines.speaker: u8301
lines.text: Costliest!

lines.speaker: u8302
lines.text: Whats that? A word?

lines.speaker: u8301
lines.text: What do you think?

lines.speaker: u8302
lines.text: I dont know. Could be the sound of jewellery hitting a parquet floor, huh?

lines.speaker: u8301
lines.text: Very funny. Can I go on now?

lines.speaker: u8302
lines.text: Sure. But speak English, will ya, ha ha...

lines.speaker: u8315
lines.text: Jeanne's alive!

lines.speaker: u8325
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: u8315
lines.text: We have to press home the attack!

lines.speaker: u8325
lines.text: Sound the retreat...

lines.speaker: u8315
lines.text: But I promised Jeanne we'd fight on!

lines.speaker: u8325
lines.text: I made no such promise.  Sound the retreat for the night!

lines.speaker: u8315
lines.text: But that was her order!

lines.speaker: u8325
lines.text: I'm fed up with taking her orders. She swore she'd defeat the English before nightfall, instead of which she goes and plays the fool and gets herself nearly killed!  Look at the mess we're in!  That's her mess, not mine...!  We're worse off then if she'd never come at all!  ... now do as I say and Sound the Retreat!

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: No, of course not... I never killed anyone...

lines.speaker: u8316
lines.text: Then perhaps the temptation to kill would have been stronger... too strong perhaps...?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: No!  I warned the English to go back home -- I begged them not to force us to fight -- they knew the defeat I would bring on them... why didn't they listen to me?

lines.speaker: u8316
lines.text: We have numerous witnesses who can confirm that you were not always carrying your banner...

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: Yes, probably... maybe...

lines.speaker: u8316
lines.text: So sometimes you were carrying just your sword?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: Yes, but...

lines.speaker: u8316
lines.text: Did you use the sword that you held in your hand?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: No, I... I held it up to...

lines.speaker: u8316
lines.text: You held up your sword and flourished it about in the air? Like this?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: Yes, maybe... I don't remember...

lines.speaker: u8316
lines.text: ... so you were in the middle of the battlefield, with your sword in your hand, waving it above your head... charging against the enemy, screaming and yelling... fighting for your life... and you want us to believe that in the middle of all this excitement you never killed anyone?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: No, I... I never killed anyone!

lines.speaker: u8317
lines.text: W-w-what are you doing?!

lines.speaker: u8338
lines.text: Performing a miracle.

lines.speaker: u8318
lines.text: Whose side are you on, Cauchon?

lines.speaker: u8321
lines.text: I'm on the side of our Mother Holy Church.  Besides, a confession under torture will never convince anyone of her guilt.

lines.speaker: u8318
lines.text: Well find some other way!  Be creative.  Tell them she fucks the devil... Hmm, not a bad idea... why can't you say that?  Sounds good to me... and who can prove she doesn't?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: My king will pay any ransom you ask.

lines.speaker: u8319
lines.text: Your king?  Ah yes, of course... What's he going to pay me with? Cows?  Chickens?  I prefer gold, and the English have plenty.  I wonder how much they'll pay... to have the Witch of Orleans in their clutches? Those English are so arrogant, they can't accept the idea of being defeated by a peasant girl... it has to have been the devil's work.

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: God defeated the English, not me.

lines.speaker: u8319
lines.text: And God who allowed you to be caught?

lines.speaker: u8320
lines.text: Quick -- hide in here...

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: What about you?

lines.speaker: u8320
lines.text: Don't worry about me -- just stay in here... and don't move!

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: But where are you going to be?

lines.speaker: u8320
lines.text: I'll be right here... I promise.

lines.speaker: u8321
lines.text: 20,000?!  But... I heard King Charles was... financially embarrassed.

lines.speaker: u8324
lines.text: Don't look at the cost, look at what it brings.  What is your last offer?

lines.speaker: u8322
lines.text: I... I don't know... it'll sound like we... betrayed her...?

lines.speaker: u8336
lines.text: Noooo!

lines.speaker: u8323
lines.text: You told us about the appearance of this... voice.  What exactly did you see?  Part of it... or all of it?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: His face.

lines.speaker: u8323
lines.text: Does he have hair?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8323
lines.text: Is it long and hanging down?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: I'm more interested in what he says, not what he looks like.

lines.speaker: u8323
lines.text: But if the devil were to take on the physical appearance of a saint or an angel... or a man... how would you recognize him?  By what he said?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: Go on to the next question.

lines.speaker: u8323
lines.text: That's enough!  You will answer the question... or face the consequences!

lines.speaker: u8334
lines.text: 8,000.  We can't raise more... We can only place ourselves at the mercy of your generosity.

lines.speaker: u8324
lines.text: I must offer to the Duke.  I will give you his answer tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u8337
lines.text: But... don't you think we should at least... go and... welcome her?

lines.speaker: u8325
lines.text: As long as she brings food and supplies, she'll be welcome.

lines.speaker: u8326
lines.text: Do you know how to count?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: Of course I do?  Bring them up!

lines.speaker: u8326
lines.text: Jeanne... that is not ten thousand reinforcements -- that is one hundred very loyal but very tired soldiers.

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: But... where is Dunois... where are the men the king promised me?

lines.speaker: u8326
lines.text: He never sent them... Don't you understand?  He doesn't want this war anymore... he has his crown now, that's all he ever wanted...

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: But my voices... they promised me...

lines.speaker: u8326
lines.text: To hell with your voices -- it's time to face facts!  We have nothing to do here... none of us... not even you.  You should go home, Jeanne.

lines.speaker: u8327
lines.text: Who told you to wear men's clothes?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: The clothes are not important...

lines.speaker: u8327
lines.text: You also cut your hair short like a man, and in the Bible it clearly states that it is an abomination for a woman to pretend to be a man!  It proves your desire to deceive...

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: It was just... more convenient as I was among soldiers...

lines.speaker: u8327
lines.text: So you think you did well to cut your hair and dress as a man?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: I... submit to Our Lord.

lines.speaker: u8327
lines.text: But will you also submit to the decision of the Church?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: It seems to me that the Church and Our Lord are one and the same.  Why must you complicate what is so simple?

lines.speaker: u8328
lines.text: Tell us, Jeanne... why did you jump from the tower at Beaurevoir?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: I had been sold to the English.  I'd rather die than fall into their hands.

lines.speaker: u8328
lines.text: Did your voice tell you to jump?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: u8328
lines.text: So when you jumped, you wanted to kill yourself?

lines.speaker: u8328
lines.text: How can you deny it when you just said "I'd rather die than fall into the hands of the English"...?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: That's now what I meant...

lines.speaker: u8328
lines.text: Do you not know that suicide is a very grievous sin?  No one is allowed to destroy the life that God created!

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: I know, but that's not the way things happened...

lines.speaker: u8328
lines.text: You mean it was not of your own free will that you were on the ledge?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: Yes, but...

lines.speaker: u8328
lines.text: And you didn't jump of your free will?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: u8328
lines.text: Oh?  Perhaps someone pushed you then?

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: I don't want to wait for his call.

lines.speaker: u8333
lines.text: Jeanne, be patient.

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: I want to be with him always...

lines.speaker: u8333
lines.text: Soon you'll be able to take the Holy Mass, and as you eat of his flesh and drink of his blood, you will be at one with him.

lines.speaker: u8329
lines.text: I want to be at one with Him now.

lines.speaker: u8339
lines.text: A beauty. Who is she?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: A singer. Her husband's an actor. I knew them well. Good people. I'd like to talk to her.

lines.speaker: u8339
lines.text: Don't forget, Mr. Wladek, they hang them for helping Jews.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: When's your baby due?

lines.speaker: u8340
lines.text: Christmas.  This is not a good time to have children. But then...

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: For what? For my tie?

lines.speaker: u8341
lines.text: American Jews, and there's lots of them, what have they done for us? What do they think they're doing? People here are dying, haven't got a bite to eat. The Jewish bankers over there should be persuading America to declare war on Germany!

lines.speaker: u8342
lines.text: I'm on the run!

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: What's happened?

lines.speaker: u8342
lines.text: The Gestapo found our weapons. They've arrested Janina and Andrzej. They're bound to find out about this place, too - you must get away at once.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Where do you want me to go?  Look at me. No, no, I'm not leaving. Can't I take my chances here?

lines.speaker: u8342
lines.text: That's your decision.  But when they storm the flat, throw yourself out of die window - don't let them get you alive. I have poison on me, they won't get me alive either!

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Halina?

lines.speaker: u8343
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Funny time to say this.

lines.speaker: u8343
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: wish I knew you better.

lines.speaker: u8343
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: u8344
lines.text: We're recruiting.

lines.speaker: u8345
lines.text: Who's recruiting?

lines.speaker: u8344
lines.text: Don't be clever with me, Henryk. I've come here as a friend. They're bringing Jews in from all over the country. Soon there'll be half a million people in the ghetto. We need more Jewish police...

lines.speaker: u8345
lines.text: Oh? More Jewish police? You mean you want me to wear a cap like yours, beat up Jews with my truncheon and catch the Gestapo spirit. I see!

lines.speaker: u8344
lines.text: Someone's got to do it, Henryk.

lines.speaker: u8345
lines.text: But why me? I thought you only recruited boys with rich fathers. Look at my father, look at us, I mean...

lines.speaker: u8344
lines.text: Yes, I'm looking at you and that's why I'm here. Your whole family can have a better life. You want to go on struggling for survival, selling books on the street?

lines.speaker: u8345
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.speaker: u8344
lines.text: I'm doing you people a favour. And what about you, Wladek? You're a great pianist. And we've got an excellent police jazz band. They'd welcome you with open arms. Join us. You've got no work...

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Very appropriate.

lines.speaker: u8345
lines.text: Yes, that's why I brought it.

lines.speaker: u8346
lines.text: No one thought they'd hold out so long.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: should never have come out. I should've stayed there, fought with them.

lines.speaker: u8346
lines.text: Wladek, stop that. It's over now. Just be proud it happened. My God, did they put up a fight.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Yes, so did the Germans.

lines.speaker: u8346
lines.text: They're in shock. They didn't expect it. Nobody expected it. Jews fighting back? Who'd have thought?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Yes, but what good did it do?

lines.speaker: u8346
lines.text: What good? Wladek, I'm surprised at you. They died with  dignity, that's what good it did. And you know something else?  Now the Poles will rise. We're ready. We'll fight, too. You'll see.

lines.speaker: u8347
lines.text: I have to say you look terrible. What's the trouble?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: You've heard the rumours they're going to resettle us in the East?

lines.speaker: u8347
lines.text: Rumours, rumours, you take it all too much to heart, Wladek.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: I've been trying to get a certificate of employment for my father. I've managed to get certificates for me and the rest of the family but I need one more for my father. I've been trying all the firms, the shops...

lines.speaker: u8347
lines.text: Why didn't you come to me?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: I didn't know you were in the certificate business.

lines.speaker: u8347
lines.text: I'm not, but Majorek is.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Can you help? I've no money...

lines.speaker: u8347
lines.text: Please, don't insult us.  Can you do something for him?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Jurek? Wladek Szpilman.

lines.speaker: u8348
lines.text: Wladek! How are you?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Fine, we're fine, thank you, and you?

lines.speaker: u8348
lines.text: Fine, we're fine in the circumstances. But I can guess what you've called about. There's nothing we can do; they won't reopen the station--

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Yes, I know, but Jurek, Jurek...

lines.speaker: u8348
lines.text: ...not even music, nothing, no radios for the Poles. But I'm sure you'll find work, Wladek, a pianist like you.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Maybe, maybe not, but, Jurek, don't be offended, I didn't call to discuss my future career.

lines.speaker: u8349
lines.text: If I play like an angel, why don't you listen?

lines.speaker: u8353
lines.text: I was listening, Kitten.

lines.speaker: u8349
lines.text: Liar, you fell asleep. Pig!

lines.speaker: u8350
lines.text: I tried your friends. They're not at that address any more.  But.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: You made contact?

lines.speaker: u8350
lines.text: Be ready to leave in two days' time. Same place as last night.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: I'm sorry, I did my best, I thought the certificates would save us all.

lines.speaker: u8352
lines.text: Stop it, Wladek.

lines.speaker: u8354
lines.text: You don't want to worry about that. My grandfather was jilted by his girl friend when he got jaundice.  In my opinion, jaundice is not very serious. Drink up.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Why didn't you come sooner? It's been over two weeks.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: What about you?

lines.speaker: u8356
lines.text: I've got another one.  Warmer.  What will you do when it's all over?

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: I'll play the piano again. On Polish radio.

lines.speaker: u8356
lines.text: Tell me your name. I'll listen out for you.

lines.speaker: u8355
lines.text: Szpilman.

lines.speaker: u8356
lines.text: Szpilman.  Good name for a pianist.

lines.speaker: u8357
lines.text: Well, that is a strong opinion.

lines.speaker: u8359
lines.text: Yes, it's unholy.

lines.speaker: u8358
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8359
lines.text: She says, throw it overboard. She doesn't want it. She says it's spoiled

lines.speaker: u8358
lines.text: I have the key here, look, I'll have it mended...

lines.speaker: u8359
lines.text: Mama.

lines.speaker: u8362
lines.text: Take this to Baines. Tell him if he ever tries to see her again I'll take off another and another and another!

lines.speaker: u8363
lines.text: Yeh, go ahead.

lines.speaker: u8384
lines.text: At the finish, it's Single Action by two, Fasanella second, Visitation third.  Line on Single Action... 3 to 2. Hell with it, that's no good.

lines.speaker: u8364
lines.text: Jesus, what a bundle.  Did you know he was that loaded?

lines.speaker: u8386
lines.text: Hell no, I just cut into him.  I woulda settled for pawning one of them shoes.

lines.speaker: u8365
lines.text: Paltrow, Sterling, Furey, and the Big Alabama are in from New Orleans. Fiskin and the Boone Kid from Denver, and Phillips, Barnett and Limehouse Chappie from New York. Those and the guys outside should give ya 30 or so to choose from.

lines.speaker: u8387
lines.text: Good, have 'em down at Stenner's old Pool Hall before 3:00.  We're gonna run through the route tonight.

lines.speaker: u8365
lines.text: Okay, Twist, but you know if this blows up, I can't do ya no good downtown.  Gondorff is Federal.

lines.speaker: u8387
lines.text: Don't worry about it, pal.

lines.speaker: u8366
lines.text: Straighten up, kid.  I wouldn't turn ya out if ya weren't ready.  I got a guy named Henry Gondorff I want you to look up.  There ain't a better insideman alive.  He'll teach ya everything ya gotta know.

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: You'll take a cut of what I make, won't ya?

lines.speaker: u8366
lines.text: I'm out, Johnny.

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: If that's the way you want it.

lines.speaker: u8366
lines.text: That's the way I want it.

lines.speaker: u8373
lines.text: I just got the count.  We'll put the take on the 4:15.

lines.speaker: u8367
lines.text: We'll be waitin'.

lines.speaker: u8368
lines.text: Buck Duff.  I was in Maxwell's boost in Troy.

lines.speaker: u8387
lines.text: You the Duff that didn't come up with his end when Little Jeff was sent up?

lines.speaker: u8368
lines.text: Wasn't no problem a mine.

lines.speaker: u8387
lines.text: He was a con man, wasn't he?

lines.speaker: u8368
lines.text: He was a tear-off rat.  He got what he deserved.  No sense helpin' pay his bills.

lines.speaker: u8387
lines.text: Shove off, Duff.

lines.speaker: u8369
lines.text: What the hell you gonna do when Snyder rushes his finger right to Lonnegan?  You're committin' suicide, kid.

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: Aw Christ, it doesn't make no difference now.  If Snyder knows about it so does everybody else. He never gets anything first...Damn, there's no answer at Luther's.

lines.speaker: u8369
lines.text: Listen to me, Hooker.  What ever you do, don't go back to your place tonight, don't go anyplace you usually go, ya hear me?  Get outa town or somethin', but...

lines.speaker: u8370
lines.text: I know I give him four threes.  We can't let him get away with that.

lines.speaker: u8377
lines.text: What am I supposed to do?  Call him for cheating better than me?

lines.speaker: u8371
lines.text: We bought ya a tap into Moe Anenberg's wire.  He's got eyes at every track in the country.  You'll get race results, odds, scratches, pole positions, everything; and just as fast as Western Union gets 'em.

lines.speaker: u8380
lines.text: Does J.J. know how to use this thing?

lines.speaker: u8371
lines.text: All he's gotta do is read.

lines.speaker: u8372
lines.text: A half mill on an eight to one shot. You're dumber than I thought, Lonnegan.

lines.speaker: u8377
lines.text: You're more gutless than I thought.

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: She coulda killed me last night.

lines.speaker: u8374
lines.text: Too many people coulda seen ya go in her room.  She was a professional. Used to work in the Dutch Schultz gang.

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: u8374
lines.text: Gondorff asked me to look after ya.

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: How do I know you're tellin' the truth.

lines.speaker: u8374
lines.text: Don't have much choice, do ya?

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: Will you wait until the chump is played?

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: Hell yes.  We don't care about the mark.  He deserves what he gets.

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: I mean completely played.  Until he's beat and the score is taken. You come in before we beat him and I'll kill him.  You'll have a tough time explaining that, won't ya.

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: All right, Hooker, but you take it on the lam, and we'll shoot you down on sight.

lines.speaker: u8375
lines.text: Just as long as I get to finish the play.

lines.speaker: u8377
lines.text: All right, Riley.  What the hell happened?

lines.speaker: u8383
lines.text: We missed him.

lines.speaker: u8377
lines.text: You weren't hired to miss him.

lines.speaker: u8383
lines.text: There wasn't any way he coulda known we was in there.  We made a clean pick on the lock and didn't leave no footprints in the hall. Somebody musta wised him up.

lines.speaker: u8377
lines.text: Yeh, and what does Cole say about that?

lines.speaker: u8383
lines.text: I don't know.  He took it hard.

lines.speaker: u8377
lines.text: All right, get outa here.  You're outta work.

lines.speaker: u8387
lines.text: We'll take it.  You manage the building at the end of the alley?

lines.speaker: u8381
lines.text: For fifteen years.

lines.speaker: u8387
lines.text: I'll need a room over there that faces this way.  How much a week?

lines.speaker: u8381
lines.text: Only rents by the month.  Two hundred and fifty for the two of them.

lines.speaker: u8387
lines.text: This is the last time I expect to see you down here.

lines.speaker: u8381
lines.text: Never heard of the place.

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: Do ya know him or don't ya?

lines.speaker: u8385
lines.text: Yeh, but I don't know where he is.

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: Well we do.  He's chummin' around with a Big C named Henry Gondorff. Ring any bells?

lines.speaker: u8385
lines.text: Sure.  Every bunco man in the country knows Gondorff.

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: There's word he's gonna run a con on the North Side here.  We got a year-old Florida warrant on him, but it's a thin beef, and he can beat it in court unless we catch him cold.  All we want you to do is pick up Hooker for us.

lines.speaker: u8385
lines.text: Why don't you pick him up yourself?

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: Cause the stoolies are used to street dicks jumpin' him.  If word gets around that Feds are in on it too, Gondorff'll fold up the whole thing.

lines.speaker: u8385
lines.text: Wouldn't that be too bad.  You'd hafta move outa this nice office ya got.

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: Don't crack wise to me, flatfoot. I spent a lotta time in dumps like this, eatin' Gondorff's dust while the bunco squad gets rich tippin' him off.  But it's not gonna happen this time.  We're not even gonna let the police know we're here.  If you keep your mouth shut and do a job, there'll be a promotion in it for ya.  And you better take it, cause I can make ya work for us without it.

lines.speaker: u8385
lines.text: What the hell good is Hooker to ya?

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: He's gonna set up Gondorff for us.

lines.speaker: u8385
lines.text: He'll never do it.

lines.speaker: u8382
lines.text: I think he will.

lines.speaker: u8393
lines.text: There's a physiological as well as a psychological angle in my father's relationship with Julia Wolf that the police have overlooked.  And I think it explains everything.  You see, my father was a sexogenarian.

lines.speaker: u8388
lines.text: He was?

lines.speaker: u8393
lines.text: Yes.  He admitted it.

lines.speaker: u8388
lines.text: Sexogerarian, eh?  Yes.  Yes.  But I can't put that in the paper.

lines.speaker: u8393
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u8388
lines.text: You know how they are... sex...

lines.speaker: u8393
lines.text: Then just say he was sixty years old.

lines.speaker: u8388
lines.text: Is that what it means?

lines.speaker: u8393
lines.text: Of course.

lines.speaker: u8389
lines.text: Mind if I look around?

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Help yourself.  Oh, Tom, show this gentleman...

lines.speaker: u8390
lines.text: Darling, don't cry.  Please.  I know it's terrible.  But isn't it really better this way?

lines.speaker: u8391
lines.text: Oh, Andy, Andy!

lines.speaker: u8391
lines.text: Poor Dad, does that still bother you?

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Only in bad weather.

lines.speaker: u8391
lines.text: But it isn't bad weather now.

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Better get home before it is.

lines.speaker: u8391
lines.text: Goodbye, darling.  Don't you dare forget...  December 30th.

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Goodbye, my boy.  Take care of Dorothy.  Show her that there is such a thing as a happy marriage.

lines.speaker: u8400
lines.text: Shrapnel!

lines.speaker: u8392
lines.text: Must have been in the war.  That might account for the cane and his limp.

lines.speaker: u8400
lines.text: Yes... yes.

lines.speaker: u8393
lines.text: I saw him too... he was wearing a green suit with a white tie...

lines.speaker: u8398
lines.text: What are you talking about, Gilbert? You weren't there!

lines.speaker: u8393
lines.text: know.  But I saw him -

lines.speaker: u8402
lines.text: I can't remember offhand, Lieutenant.  Maybe I was over at Charlie's shooting pool. Maybe I was here.  She'd remember.

lines.speaker: u8394
lines.text: How'd you like to be thrown in the can on account of not remembering?

lines.speaker: u8402
lines.text: Just give me a minute....  I'll remember. I'm not stalling, Lieutenant.  You know I always come clean with you.  Gee, it'd serve me right if you had pinched me...  that's the afternoon I was.... wait, I'll show you...!

lines.speaker: u8398
lines.text: and there she was lying dead.  The police said she'd probably been killed about ten minutes before I got there.

lines.speaker: u8395
lines.text: I thought you said you weren't going there.

lines.speaker: u8398
lines.text: Why, you said...

lines.speaker: u8395
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.speaker: u8396
lines.text: That's a fine thing to throw up to me after all I've been to you....

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Hello ....  give me ....  Well ....  ?

lines.speaker: u8396
lines.text: I'll give it back to you ....  all I've got ....twenty-five thousand...

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: You're going to return every cent of it!

lines.speaker: u8396
lines.text: I can't! I haven't got it!

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: What did you do with the rest?

lines.speaker: u8396
lines.text: I never had it.

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Then someone was in with you.  Who was it? -- Who was it?  I'll answer that --  Hello ...  hello ...

lines.speaker: u8397
lines.text: I have no right to answer that.

lines.speaker: u8400
lines.text: What about it, Tanner.  Isn't that the truth?

lines.speaker: u8398
lines.text: Nobody told me.  I did see him!

lines.speaker: u8400
lines.text: What did he pay you, Mimi, to stick to that story?

lines.speaker: u8398
lines.text: It isn't a story - it's true.  I did see Wynant.  He's not dead.

lines.speaker: u8400
lines.text: You're lying, Mimi.  But then, you'd do anything for money.  You're getting a good price for saying you saw Wynant and you figure you won't get anything if he's dead.

lines.speaker: u8398
lines.text: I'm lot going to stay here to be insulted -

lines.speaker: u8400
lines.text: Macaulay, you drew up Wynant's will.  Mimi was cut off, wasn't she, if she re-married?

lines.speaker: u8399
lines.text: What am I?  The fall guy?

lines.speaker: u8400
lines.text: I hope you won't let this news spoil your dinner.  Nice food, isn't it?

lines.speaker: u8404
lines.text: That's what Mr. Wynant said to me. If she re-married, all the money was to go to the children.

lines.speaker: u8400
lines.text: You shouldn't let that keep you from telling truth, Mimi.  Mrs. Jorgensen -  Were you ever divorced from Chris Jorgensen?

lines.speaker: u8401
lines.text: Was he a good detective?

lines.speaker: u8403
lines.text: I wouldn't know.  That time he caught me was a accident.  I led with my right.

lines.speaker: u8404
lines.text: Well, congratulations.

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: I'm going to give her a wedding present.  Thought I'd better do it now, before I forget it.  I can drop them on my way to...  That's funny....  Where are those bonds?

lines.speaker: u8404
lines.text: Bonds, sir?

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: I know I left them there.

lines.speaker: u8404
lines.text: Maybe Miss Wolf has them.

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Maybe she has.

lines.speaker: u8404
lines.text: You're forgetting the check for your suitcase.  It's at the Grand Central.

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Oh, yes -- yes -- that's right --

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Where are you going?

lines.speaker: u8405
lines.text: Home!

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Home?

lines.speaker: u8405
lines.text: I'm fired.

lines.speaker: u8406
lines.text: Who fired you?

lines.speaker: u8405
lines.text: You did.

lines.speaker: u8408
lines.text: Where were you going?

lines.speaker: u8407
lines.text: Baghdad.

lines.speaker: u8408
lines.text: What's in the other direction?

lines.speaker: u8407
lines.text: This road, it leads straight to Kuwait.

lines.speaker: u8408
lines.text: Turn the car around.

lines.speaker: u8407
lines.text: Please, I beg of you.  The American army is there.  I am Iraqi.  They will kill me.

lines.speaker: u8408
lines.text: Nobody's going to hurt you.

lines.speaker: u8409
lines.text: He's not slowing.

lines.speaker: u8408
lines.text: He's going to slow down.

lines.speaker: u8410
lines.text: When my Shi'ite friends saw that they had shot an American they were very apologetic.  Turns out we've been kicking ass in this little war.  They figure we've finally gotten Saddam off their backs.  They brought me to their camp, cleaned me up, fed me... I'm their new best buddy.  America number one, Joe. But there's something the Shi'ites can't figure out:  They can't figure out why my two buddies, two fellow Americans, left me out in the desert.  They can't seem to figure out what those same two guys were doing in an Iraqi outpost.  It's almost as if they were Iraqi spies, or something.  And I've got to tell you they hate anything that's got to do with the Iraqis.  See how I mean?

lines.speaker: u8409
lines.text: We had to take shelter in the checkpoint. Jesus, Wes, I killed the Iraqis in there.

lines.speaker: u8410
lines.text: You actually got around to killing someone.  I'm impressed.  I guess you're only half a bitch.

lines.speaker: u8412
lines.text: 4000 degrees is usually the point of....?

lines.speaker: u8413
lines.text: Vocasity

lines.speaker: u8412
lines.text: No, Tetanty.

lines.speaker: u8414
lines.text: THX!

lines.speaker: u8415
lines.text: We must escape.  We have plans. We can leave.  We must wait until...

lines.speaker: u8420
lines.text: Incredible!

lines.speaker: u8420
lines.text: I've got it!  Astounding!

lines.speaker: u8416
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8420
lines.text: No one could have imagined anything one-thousandth as fantastic as the sober facts uncovered by patient inquiry.  This world is in a state of static-mobility:  we are at the same time moving and standing still.

lines.speaker: u8417
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8419
lines.text: Look!

lines.speaker: u8418
lines.text: Just look at all those people.

lines.speaker: u8419
lines.text: I thought of something.....

lines.speaker: u8421
lines.text: You are engaged in an unauthorized procedure.  Check cybernetic manual F-45.  If you do no have an F-45, you are in violation.  This is a double A restricted precinct. Remain where you are.  Authorities will arrive shortly.

lines.speaker: u8419
lines.text: You should know better than that!

lines.speaker: u8422
lines.text: Coffee, Mike?

lines.speaker: u8428
lines.text: No thanks, Bev.

lines.speaker: u8428
lines.text: Dispatch, this is Reilly.

lines.speaker: u8423
lines.text: Go ahead.

lines.speaker: u8428
lines.text: Patch me through to the Bomb Squad.

lines.speaker: u8423
lines.text: Aren't you on suspension?

lines.speaker: u8428
lines.text: Just do it.

lines.speaker: u8423
lines.text: Hang on.

lines.speaker: u8431
lines.text: Jesus...

lines.speaker: u8424
lines.text: Reilly! He's loaded!

lines.speaker: u8430
lines.text: Drop it.

lines.speaker: u8425
lines.text: Take him!

lines.speaker: u8426
lines.text: I'm filing charges against that mother-

lines.speaker: u8432
lines.text: Can it, Pluchinsky. And shove some cotton up your nose.

lines.speaker: u8427
lines.text: Oh shit...

lines.speaker: u8431
lines.text: Fuck factor ten.

lines.speaker: u8432
lines.text: Reilly, what's happening? Reilly! Reilly! Do not engage. We're five minutes-

lines.speaker: u8428
lines.text: We'll keep him pinned in, you guys hurry up!

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: What?  I may lose it again? But I haven't found it yet! I'm sorry. Goodbye!  Yes?

lines.speaker: u8433
lines.text: So you lost a handbag, madame?

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8433
lines.text: And it had diamonds in the back.

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8433
lines.text: And diamonds in the front.

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8433
lines.text: Diamonds all over.

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Well, have you found it?

lines.speaker: u8433
lines.text: No!  But let me tell you--any woman who spends a fortune in times like these for a handbag--phooey, phooey, phooey!

lines.speaker: u8434
lines.text: M'sieu Giron is downstairs.

lines.speaker: u8437
lines.text: Tell M'sieu Giron I can't see him now. Impossible!  And, Jacques. Dismiss the car! Madame is not going.

lines.speaker: u8434
lines.text: Yes, M'sieu Laval!

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: With the compliments of Colet and Company!

lines.speaker: u8435
lines.text: He bows, goes. Door shuts behind him.

lines.speaker: u8436
lines.text: He's really not a bad fellow.

lines.speaker: u8441
lines.text: Just dull.

lines.speaker: u8436
lines.text: Insignificant ... He's a secretary, always <u>was</u> a secretary, always <u>will</u> be.

lines.speaker: u8441
lines.text: Funny--the first time I saw him I thought he was a doctor!

lines.speaker: u8436
lines.text: Doc--!

lines.speaker: u8437
lines.text: Goodbye...

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Goodbye.

lines.speaker: u8437
lines.text: It could have been marvelous ...

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Divine ...

lines.speaker: u8437
lines.text: Wonderful ... But tomorrow morning, if you should wake out of your dreams and hear a knock, and the door opens, and there, instead of a maid with a breakfast tray, stands a policeman with a warrant--then you'll be glad you're alone.

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: But it could have been glorious.

lines.speaker: u8437
lines.text: Lovely.

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Divine ... But that terrible policeman!

lines.speaker: u8437
lines.text: Goodbye ...

lines.speaker: u8444
lines.text: Oh, no, it's the way you lead.

lines.speaker: u8438
lines.text: No, madame, it's the way you <u>follow</u>.

lines.speaker: u8444
lines.text: No, m'sieu!

lines.speaker: u8438
lines.text: Yes, madame!

lines.speaker: u8444
lines.text: Well, the evening is still young. Let's go down to the living room and talk it over.  It's only ten o'clock.

lines.speaker: u8439
lines.text: Madame Colet, I've enjoyed the confidence of your family for more than forty years.  I was a school friend of your husband's ...

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: I know!

lines.speaker: u8439
lines.text: Madame, let me ask you: Who is M'sieu Laval, anyhow? Where does he come from? What is he?

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: He is my secretary! I hope that answers all your questions, M'sieu Giron.

lines.speaker: u8439
lines.text: You know what Paris is saying about the Countess Falconier and her chauffeur?

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Jacques!

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: I think you'd better go.

lines.speaker: u8440
lines.text: Ever had a romance with a crook?

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: I beg your pardon!

lines.speaker: u8440
lines.text: Let me give you a little advice. When you embrace him, be sure to put on your gloves. It would be too bad if your fingerprints were found ...

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Mademoiselle Gautier--or whatever your name is--I thank you for your advice, but I must ask you to go. You've got your money--

lines.speaker: u8440
lines.text: I don't want your money!

lines.speaker: u8441
lines.text: Your bag?

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Yes, my bag!

lines.speaker: u8441
lines.text: Didn't you take it with you?

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Apparently not. Don't you know where it is?

lines.speaker: u8441
lines.text: No--I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: But you saw it here.

lines.speaker: u8441
lines.text: Yes, I saw it--but--

lines.speaker: u8443
lines.text: Well, where is it?

lines.speaker: u8446
lines.text: Good luck to you, Rose.

lines.speaker: u8462
lines.text: And to you, Mr. Andrews.

lines.speaker: u8447
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.speaker: u8460
lines.text: Don't drop it Rose.

lines.speaker: u8447
lines.text: Rush her.

lines.speaker: u8460
lines.text: It's hers, you schmuck.  Look, Rose, I... I don't know what to say to a woman who tries to jump off the Titanic when it's not sinking, and jumps back onto it when it is... we're not dealing with logic here, I know that... but please... think about this a second.

lines.speaker: u8458
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8448
lines.text: That's the shape my hand's gonna be when I hold that thing. You understand? I'm not leaving here without it.

lines.speaker: u8458
lines.text: Look, Brock, she's going to do this her way, in her own time. Don't forget, she contacted you. She's out here for her own reasons, God knows what they are.

lines.speaker: u8449
lines.text: I told you you wanted to take this call.

lines.speaker: u8460
lines.text: Alright. You have my attention, Rose. Can you tell me who the woman in the picture is?

lines.speaker: u8450
lines.text: You're a good liar.

lines.speaker: u8455
lines.text: Almost as good as you.

lines.speaker: u8450
lines.text: I always win, Jack. One way or another.  Pity I didn't keep that drawing. It's going to be worth a lot more by morning.

lines.speaker: u8451
lines.text: The boats are all going.

lines.speaker: u8455
lines.text: We gotta get up there or we're gonna be gargling saltwater. Where's Tommy?

lines.speaker: u8452
lines.text: Oy, mate... that was a close shave.

lines.speaker: u8456
lines.text: Smell ice, can you? Bleedin' Christ!

lines.speaker: u8461
lines.text: I don't understand a one of you. What's the matter with you? It's your men back there! We got plenty a' room for more.

lines.speaker: u8453
lines.text: If you don't shut that hole in yer face, there'll be one less in this boat!

lines.speaker: u8454
lines.text: Why have we stopped?

lines.speaker: u8464
lines.text: We've struck ice.

lines.speaker: u8454
lines.text: Well, do you think the ship is seriously damaged?

lines.speaker: u8464
lines.text: Excuse me.

lines.speaker: u8455
lines.text: You must do me this honor... promise me you will survive... that you will never give up... no matter what happens... no matter how hopeless... promise me now, and never let go of that promise.

lines.speaker: u8462
lines.text: I promise.

lines.speaker: u8455
lines.text: Never let go.

lines.speaker: u8462
lines.text: I promise. I will never let go, Jack. I'll never let go.

lines.speaker: u8457
lines.text: I don't think I've ever seen such a flat calm, in 24 years at sea.

lines.speaker: u8464
lines.text: Yes, like a mill pond. Not a breath of wind.

lines.speaker: u8457
lines.text: It's make the bergs harder to see, with no breaking water at the base.

lines.speaker: u8464
lines.text: Mmmmm. Well, I'm off. Maintain speed and heading, Mr. Lightoller.

lines.speaker: u8457
lines.text: Yes sir.

lines.speaker: u8464
lines.text: And wake me, of course, if anything becomes in the slightest degree doubtful.

lines.speaker: u8458
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u8460
lines.text: We were pissin' in the wind the whole time.

lines.speaker: u8462
lines.text: Don't come any closer.

lines.speaker: u8460
lines.text: You had it the entire time?!

lines.speaker: u8463
lines.text: Rose, get in the boat!

lines.speaker: u8462

lines.text: James Cole.  That's everything we got.  None of the James Coles on the computer match him. No license, no prints, no warrants.  Nothing. You want me to go in with you?

lines.speaker: u8666
lines.text: No, thank you.

lines.speaker: u8662
lines.text: I'll be right here...just in case.

lines.speaker: u8666
lines.text: Nine thirty

lines.speaker: u8667
lines.text: Might be tight.

lines.speaker: u8666
lines.text: Tight?  My watch says 7:30.

lines.speaker: u8667
lines.text: On your normal mornin', okay, plenty a time, but today, gotta take inta account your Army-of-the-Twelve-Monkeys factor.

lines.speaker: u8666
lines.text: What?  What did you say?

lines.speaker: u8667
lines.text: Twelve Monkeys, honey.  Guess you folks didn't turn on your radio this morning.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: Any parting words of wisdom?

lines.speaker: u8668
lines.text: Things ain't always the way they seem. You got to ask yourself; is it worth it?

lines.speaker: u8669
lines.text: And what are you?  A rocket scientist?

lines.speaker: u8672
lines.text: I got more brains than you've got teeth.

lines.speaker: u8669
lines.text: Put your money where your chicken- lipped mouth is.  I'll bet this mornings pay I'm right.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: Please, you don't understand.  I have to get out of here.  They're going to come looking for me. They're going to kill me.  If I can't get this ticket then I'm going to have to do things to get out of here.  I don't want to hurt anybody, I just want to leave.

lines.speaker: u8670
lines.text: I'll give you the money!  Okay? I'll give you two-fifty.  Just . . . just, please.

lines.speaker: u8671
lines.text: Two-hundred dollars in hundred- dollar bills.  And this morning you was broke.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: What's it to you?

lines.speaker: u8671
lines.text: I don't want no dirty money.  I run an honest business.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: Honest like Al Capone on tax day. Where are my keys?

lines.speaker: u8673
lines.text: Ned!  Now look at what you done! Are you all right?

lines.speaker: u8679
lines.text: I think I burned my gun hand!

lines.speaker: u8673
lines.text: It'd serve you right.  Jose, run get a mop and clean this mess up.

lines.speaker: u8674
lines.text: John, if you don't throw me the keys, then I'll just walk away. Walk away and leave you here.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: Walk to where?  We're fifty miles to the nearest town.  It's going to be over one-hundred degrees today.  How far do you think you're going to get?

lines.speaker: u8674
lines.text: Someone will find me.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: Yeah, they'll find you.  Dried up and twice dead.

lines.speaker: u8674
lines.text: You idiot!  You'll kill us both!

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: At least I'll have company when I die.  Ain't that right, Jake?

lines.speaker: u8674
lines.text: For Christ's sake, John!  Throw me the keys!

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: What do you say, Jake?  Should we trust her?  No?  I didn't think so.

lines.speaker: u8674
lines.text: Fuck you!  Do you hear me, John!? Fuck you!  John . . . John!?

lines.speaker: u8675
lines.text: You'd tell me anything to save your pathetic life.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: You know what kind of woman Grace is.  You know how badly she wants to get the fuck out of Sierra.  What makes you think when you were planning on killing her she wasn't doing the same for you?  What's she to you, Jake; a woman who would have you dead?  Let me kill her.  All I want is two-hundred dollars to get out of here with.

lines.speaker: u8675
lines.text: Two-hundred dollars.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: Two-hundred dollars . . . that's how I put a price on murder.

lines.speaker: u8676
lines.text: Don't be afraid of him none.  I don't care what he does to you, we can still be together.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: Get away from me!

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: No police.

lines.speaker: u8681
lines.text: But, Senor--

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: No police!  Wait until I'm gone.

lines.speaker: u8681
lines.text: Senor, you need a doctor.

lines.speaker: u8677
lines.text: No police!

lines.speaker: u8683
lines.text: You <u>are</u> crazy, you know. Be seeing you, old man.

lines.speaker: u8682
lines.text: You know I won't be seeing you.

lines.speaker: u8686
lines.text: Shasta!  Now why'd you go and scare the nice man like that?  Sorry about that, mister.  Let's see, you want $3.25.  You try to have a nice day now, would you?

lines.speaker: u8683
lines.text: Sure, I'll try.

lines.speaker: u8692
lines.text: Son of a bitch!

lines.speaker: u8692
lines.text: I think I burned my gun hand!

lines.speaker: u8688
lines.text: Help me, Grace, help...

lines.speaker: u8687
lines.text: Like you helped her, Jake?

lines.speaker: u8689
lines.text: Toby!  Toby Tucker, leave him alone!

lines.speaker: u8693
lines.text: You stay away, Jenny.  I aim to mess him up, and that ain't a thing for a woman to see.

lines.speaker: u8692
lines.text: Get out of the car, spread them. You can jawbone all you want or you have the right to <u>shut the fuck up</u>! You commie motherfucker. Either way you're goin' to the can.

lines.speaker: u8691
lines.text: I want my lawyer!

lines.speaker: u8695
lines.text: Is that the entire message?

lines.speaker: u8697
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8698
lines.text: I'm listening.

lines.speaker: u8696
lines.text: I'll keep it in my office room.

lines.text: What about Jeb?

lines.speaker: u8696
lines.text: I have a lock on the door.

lines.text: Where were you sitting on the train?

lines.speaker: u8697
lines.text: Against a window.

lines.speaker: u8701
lines.text: In the passenger car?

lines.speaker: u8697
lines.text: Yes. Where are the rest of the passengers?

lines.speaker: u8701
lines.text: Was your family traveling with you?

lines.speaker: u8697
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u8701
lines.text: Did you get up from your seat?

lines.speaker: u8697
lines.text: No.

lines.text: Well, go get it then.

lines.speaker: u8698
lines.text: Where is it?

lines.speaker: u8699
lines.text: On a bench, across the street.

lines.speaker: u8709
lines.text: I didn't think they'd really do it.

lines.speaker: u8705
lines.text: What did you think, they come clear up from Kansas to fuck us?

lines.speaker: u8709
lines.text: That Kid... he's just a... boy. And that other one, Bill, being true to his wife...

lines.speaker: u8705
lines.text: What wife? He don't have no wife.

lines.speaker: u8709
lines.text: He said...

lines.speaker: u8705
lines.text: I told you, he don't have no wife, not aboveground, anyhow.

lines.text: Now this Strawberry Alice person, tell me again.

lines.speaker: u8706
lines.text: Down the street and across. Greely's Beer Garden and Billiard parlor. Just ask for Alice and say you want a game of billiards.

lines.speaker: u8710
lines.text: Billiards, eh? Even though I don't really wish to play?

lines.speaker: u8706
lines.text: Don't matter. They burned the table in '78 for firewood.

lines.speaker: u8710
lines.text: Ah, I see.

lines.speaker: u8707
lines.text: We never seen him up against any... like these ones... killers.

lines.speaker: u8708
lines.text: Little Bill come out of Kansas an' Texas, boys. He worked them tough towns.

lines.speaker: u8707
lines.text: Just wondered. Anybody could be scared.

lines.text: He tell you where them others is?

lines.speaker: u8708
lines.text: Nope.

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: He give 'em names?

lines.speaker: u8708
lines.text: Didn't give us nothin' but his own name... Ned Roundtree.

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: Well, Ned, you'll want to tell me an' Mister Beauchamp here all about them two villainous friends of yours, I guess.  Bring him in, boys, for I will be glad to know the names and the whereabouts of those other two murdering sonsofbitches.

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: You're a beautiful woman an'... if I was to want a free one, I guess I'd want you more than them others. It ain't... See... I can't have no free one on account of my wife...

lines.speaker: u8709
lines.text: Your wife?

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Yeah. See?

lines.speaker: u8709
lines.text: I admire that, you being true to your wife. I've seen a lot of... of men... who weren't.

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Yeah, I guess.

lines.speaker: u8709
lines.text: She back in Kansas?

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Uh... yeah. Yeah. She's uh... watchin' over the little ones.

lines.speaker: u8710
lines.text: Mmmm pistols.

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.text: We got one of them fuckers, Sheriff, out by Cow Creek, we...

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: Alive?

lines.speaker: u8711
lines.text: Hell, yeah. A bunch of us Bar T boys went out lookin' on account of them killin' one of our own. We come across this fucker on a roan goin' South an'...

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: He admit it?

lines.speaker: u8711
lines.text: No... but I guess he will soon enough. Had a Spencer rifle on him an' he was...

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: Those cowboys messin' him up?

lines.speaker: u8711
lines.text: Uh... a little, maybe.

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: You an' Andy get the hell out there. Find out where them other two went.

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: I do not like assassins an' men of low character like your friend English Bob... but Bob ain't no coward who will cry to your face an' then...

lines.speaker: u8719
lines.text: Uh... Sheriff... Uh...

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: Huh? Oh.  Another one, huh? Shit, I guess I'm clean out of receptacles.

lines.speaker: u8719
lines.text: Maybe you should... hang the carpenter.

lines.speaker: u8712
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8719
lines.text: Uh... hang the... uh... carpenter. I...

lines.speaker: u8713
lines.text: He said how you was really Three Fingered Jack out of Missouri... an' Bill said "Same Three Fingered Jack that dynamited the Rock Island and Pacific in '69 killin' women and children an' all?" An' Ned says you done a lot worse than that, said you was more cold blooded than William Bonney or Clay Alisson or the James Brothers an' how if he hurt Ned again you was gonna come an' kill him like you killed a U.S. Marshall in '73.

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Didn't scare Little Bill though, did it?

lines.speaker: u8713
lines.text: N-no, sir?

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Lemmee see that Schofield, Kid.

lines.text: Did you... did you... ?

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Did I what?

lines.speaker: u8718
lines.text: All that money... I mean... did you...?

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Steal it? Naw, I didn't steal it.

lines.speaker: u8718
lines.text: No... I meant...

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u8718
lines.text: K-k-kill somebody?

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Who said that?

lines.speaker: u8718
lines.text: N-nobody... only you took your shotgun an' that pistol an'...

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Before I met your maw, God rest her soul, it used to be I was kinda... wicked... drinkin' spirits an' gettin' into scrapes an' all. Only she made me see the error of my ways an'... I ain't like I was no more.

lines.speaker: u8718
lines.text: I guess you didn't kill nobody then.

lines.speaker: u8714
lines.text: Naw, son, I didn't kill nobody.

lines.text: He's gonna die, ain't he?

lines.speaker: u8715
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.speaker: u8717
lines.text: Well, suppose he does?

lines.speaker: u8715
lines.text: We'll bury him.

lines.speaker: u8717
lines.text: That ain't what I mean.

lines.speaker: u8715
lines.text: You mean, am I gonna help you kill them cowboys?

lines.speaker: u8717
lines.text: I can't spot 'em myself but you could. That red-haired one, you could spot a half-mile off, I bet.

lines.speaker: u8715
lines.text: An' if I spot 'em?

lines.speaker: u8717
lines.text: I'll ride up close an' shoot 'em!

lines.speaker: u8715
lines.text: Just like that?

lines.speaker: u8717
lines.text: I told you I'm a damn killer. I done it before.  I'm more killer than him.

lines.speaker: u8715
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: u8717
lines.text: Hell, yeah.

lines.speaker: u8721
lines.text: <<Are you sure?>>

lines.speaker: u8727
lines.text: <<Don't be stupid.>>

lines.text: He says the hair is longer and lighter.

lines.text: So what is it you do, Mr. Kint?

lines.text: Umm ...

lines.text: A hijacker like Dean, here? Or something more creative?

lines.speaker: u8724
lines.text: It's bullshit. This guy could be L.A.P.D. I think it's a setup.

lines.speaker: u8724
lines.text: Me too.

lines.text: Did you hear what he just said?

lines.text: If I'm going in, I want a stake.

lines.speaker: u8725
lines.text: Who is he?

lines.speaker: u8731
lines.text: Some Limey. He's a middle-man for somebody. He doesn't say and I don't ask.

lines.speaker: u8725
lines.text: We want to meet him.

lines.speaker: u8731
lines.text: He wants to meet you. He called last night and asked me to set it up. What do I tell him'

lines.speaker: u8725
lines.text: Tell him we'll meet.

lines.speaker: u8728
lines.text: You're not safe on your own.

lines.speaker: u8732
lines.text: You think he's..?

lines.speaker: u8728
lines.text: Is he Keyser Soze I don't know, Verbal. It seems to me that Keyser Sate is a shield. Like you said, a spook story, but I know Keaton - and someone out there is pulling strings for you. Stay here and let us protect you.

lines.speaker: u8732
lines.text: I'm not bait. No way. I post today.

lines.speaker: u8728
lines.text: You posted twenty minutes ago. Captain Leo wants you out of here a.s.a.p., unless you turn state's.

lines.speaker: u8732
lines.text: I'11 take my chances, thank you. It's tougher to buy the cheapest bag-man than it is to buy a cop.

lines.speaker: u8728
lines.text: Where are you going to go, Verbal? You gonna run? Turn states evidence. You might never see trial. If somebody wants to get you, you know They'll get you out there.

lines.speaker: u8732
lines.text: Maybe so, but I'm no rat, Agent Kujan. You tricked me, that's all. I won't keep my mouth shut 'cause I'm scared. I'11 keep it shut 'cause I let Keaton down by getting caught - Edie Finneran too. And if they kill me, it's

lines.speaker: u8735
lines.text: I'11 take my chances then. I'11 feel safer without a job if a man like Mr. Kint is behind bars.

lines.text: Mr. Kint will plead guilty to weapons possession.

lines.speaker: u8735
lines.text: You're joking.

lines.speaker: u8734
lines.text: Weapons. Misdemeanor one.

lines.speaker: u8735
lines.text: Counselor, you're insulting me.

lines.speaker: u8734
lines.text: Counselor, you're bluffing. Shall I push for misdemeanor two?

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: Mr. Abraham...

lines.speaker: u8736
lines.text: Abrams...

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: Abrams.  Yes.  How are you today?

lines.speaker: u8736
lines.text: I'm fine.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: Good.    You ever been inside a hospital?

lines.speaker: u8736
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: Ah.  How did they treat you?

lines.speaker: u8738
lines.text: If we were to go to trial, would we win the case?

lines.speaker: u8737
lines.text: Well, of course, it's always dangerous ...

lines.speaker: u8738
lines.text: I know that answer.  If we went to trial would we win?

lines.speaker: u8737
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8738
lines.text: Nothing that we can do can make that woman well.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: And no one will know the truth.

lines.speaker: u8738
lines.text: What is the truth?

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: That that poor girl put her trust in the hands of two men who took her life, she's in a coma, her life is gone.  She has no family, she has no home, she's tied to a machine, she has no friends --and the people who should care for her:  her Doctors, and you, and me, have been bought off to look the other way.  We have been paid to look the other way.  I came in here to take your money.   I brought snapshots to show you. So I could get your money.   I can't take it.  If I take it. If I take that money I'm lost. I'm just going to be a rich ambulance chaser.    I can't do it. I can't take it.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: That's the call that I'm waiting for.

lines.speaker: u8739
lines.text: What does it mean?

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: They want to settle.    It means a lot of money.

lines.speaker: u8739
lines.text: Does that mean I'm back for awhile?

lines.speaker: u8740
lines.text: ...what in the world would induce you to make a photocopy of some obscure record and hold it fouryears?  This is a...why?  Why would you do that?

lines.speaker: u8748
lines.text: I thought I would need it.

lines.speaker: u8740
lines.text: And why, please tell us, would you think that?

lines.speaker: u8748
lines.text: After, after the operation, when that poor girl, she went in a coma. Dr. Towler called me in.  He told me he had five difficult deliveries in a row and he was tired, and he never looked at the admittance form.    And he told me to change the form.  He told me to change the one to a nine.   Or else, or else, he said...  He said he'd fire me.  He said I'd never work again....Who were these men...? Who were these men...?  I wanted to be  a nurse...

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: If I could accept the offer right now, I would.  They took it back.

lines.speaker: u8741
lines.text: I understand.    I went to the Bar Association.  They tell me you're going to be disbarred.

lines.speaker: u8742
lines.text: You sure you don't want me to stay on.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: No.  No.  Thank you. You go home.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: 'Practice and Methodology in Anaesthesia.'  General textbook on the subject.  Is  that correct?

lines.speaker: u8743
lines.text: I.  Yes.  It is.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: And you wrote that...

lines.speaker: u8743
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: ...Page 414, 'If a patient has taken nourishment within one hour prior to inducement, general anaesthetic should be avoided at all costs because of the grave risk the patient will aspirate food particles into his mask.'  Is that what happened to Deborah  Ann Kaye?  She aspirated into her mask?

lines.speaker: u8743
lines.text: She threw up in her mask, yes. But she hadn't eaten one hour prior to admission.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: If she had eaten, say one hour prior to admission, the inducement of a general anaesthetic...the type you gave her... would have been negligent...?

lines.speaker: u8743
lines.text: Negligent.  Yes...it would have been criminal.  But that was not the case.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u8755
lines.text: Brain damage could have been...it didn't necessarily take nine minutes, it could have been caused in two...

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait, you're saying that her brain damage could have been caused by her being deprived of oxygen for two minutes...?

lines.speaker: u8755
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8744
lines.text: Huh.  And why is that?

lines.speaker: u8755
lines.text: Because she was anemic.  It's right there on her chart. Her brain was getting less oxygen anyway...

lines.text: Stearns, Harrington, you know who that is?

lines.text: Should I?

lines.speaker: u8749
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u8752
lines.text: ...and he's making a billion dollars every minute working for Stearns, Harrington, and he bought a dog, and everything is rosy.   Then Mr. Stearns, he tried to fix a case.

lines.text: The Big Boy did...?

lines.speaker: u8752
lines.text: That Frank was working on.  Yeah. He thought Franky needed some help, so they bribed a juror.  So Franky finds out.  He comes to me in tears. He thinks that anybody who knows what a 'spinnaker' is got to be a saint.  I told him ' Franky, wake up.  These people are sharks. What do you think they got so rich from?  Doing good?'  He can't be comforted.  He tells the boys at Stearns and Harrington they've disappointed him, he's going to the Judge to rat them out.

lines.speaker: u8749
lines.text: Huh.

lines.text: Before he can get there here comes this Federal Marshal, and Franky's indicted for Jury tampering, they throw him in jail, he's gonna be disbarred, his life is over.   Jimmy, gimme another drink.    How are you?

lines.speaker: u8749

lines.speaker: u8752
lines.text: Okay.  Now, so he's in jail.  He, finally, he gets to see the light, he calls up Harrington, he says he thinks he made a mistake.  As if by magic, charges against him are dropped, he's released from jail.   P.S.  He's fired from the firm, his wife divorces him, he turns to drink  and mopes around three and a half years.   You like that story?

lines.speaker: u8764
lines.text: Doctor, how long is it going to take you to pull him out of this?

lines.speaker: u8758
lines.text: It is hard to say. Six months, at least. Perhaps a year. It depends to a certain extent on him.

lines.speaker: u8764
lines.text: He won't talk.

lines.speaker: u8758
lines.text: No. We have ways of digging out knowledge. But it takes longer. He is suffering from acute melancholia, together with a guilt complex. He blames himself for what happened to the woman. And we know little of the background.

lines.speaker: u8764
lines.text: I can give you one thing: he was in love with her.

lines.speaker: u8758
lines.text: Ah? That complicates the problem.

lines.speaker: u8764
lines.text: I'll give you another complication: he still is.

lines.speaker: u8759
lines.text: He had no right to say that. It was my responsibility. You didn't know her. I shouldn't have got you involved.

lines.speaker: u8759
lines.text: No, there's nothing you have to say to me. I'm getting out, Scottie. For good. I can't stay here. I'm winding up her affairs, and mine. I'm going to get as far away as I can. Probably Europe. And I'll probably never come back.  Good-bye, Scottie. If there's anything I can do for you before I go...

lines.speaker: u8767
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: u8760
lines.text: Did she hurt herself?

lines.speaker: u8767
lines.text: No. She's in fine shape. Nothing to worry about. But she doesn't know. You understand that. She doesn't know what she did.

lines.speaker: u8761
lines.text: Love me... keep me safe...

lines.speaker: u8767
