lines.text: So here we are. Dead. But we never want you to want for anything. That is, we want you to have everything.

lines.speaker: u8903
lines.text: Everything.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: I wondered about them, for so many years. I wondered if I looked like them, acted like them. I wondered why they gave me up.

lines.speaker: u8896
lines.text: Giving you up was the most unselfish thing they ever did. When they founded "Heaven," they wished they could take you back but it was too late. All they could do was build the empire, knowing that someday it would all be yours.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: My legacy.

lines.speaker: u8896
lines.text: Your parents would be crushed to think you weren't happy with it.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: They're not my parents, Helen. My parents are back in Xenia and I hurt them very much.

lines.speaker: u8896
lines.text: I understand.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: And the girl I love, she hates "Heaven." If I keep it, she'll never respect me.

lines.speaker: u8896
lines.text: But how can you respect yourself if you don't?

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: Matter of fact, Jay, my uncle and I are planning to rethink the magazine. To expand the traditional western notions of "beauty."

lines.speaker: u8897
lines.text: I see, so you'd be open to little ladies from Pasadena, who want to show you their knickers?

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: Matter of fact, Jay, I'm planning a pictorial focusing on the women of my hometown, "The Girls of Xenia." Just to show my appreciation.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: Great.

lines.speaker: u8898
lines.text: From my wise, albeit youthful, vantage point, the world is your oyster. You scored big.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: They're playing our song.  Dare I ask for this dance?

lines.speaker: u8899
lines.text: You better.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: I need your help.  I'm really in deep shit.

lines.speaker: u8900
lines.text: Don't say "shit," honey. Use the strong vocabulary God gave you.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: You kicked us off your turf, Merk. Don't rain on our parade.

lines.speaker: u8901
lines.text: Mr. Nelson, you disappoint me. First you break our school board rules. Then you break the law.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: What law, Merk? Having fun? Letting down our hair on prom night?

lines.speaker: u8901
lines.text: Our state has a zero tolerance policy for underage drinking.

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: You called the cops on us?

lines.speaker: u8901
lines.text: Alcohol does horrible things to a developing young mind.

lines.speaker: u8905
lines.text: Are you familiar with "Heaven?"

lines.speaker: u8902
lines.text: I'm seventeen. I know it like the back of my hand.

lines.speaker: u8905
lines.text: Your fathered owned the entire "Heaven" empire.  You own it now. Any questions?

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: How you doing, Artie?

lines.speaker: u8906
lines.text: I... You know... I...

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: Hey, I've got it, I may as well spend it, right?  I've always wanted to live where I could dive for my dinner.

lines.speaker: u8907
lines.text: And where might that be?

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: I was thinking, Antigua, maybe.

lines.speaker: u8907
lines.text: I love Antigua.  Maybe I'll come visit you.

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: I'd like that.

lines.speaker: u8908
lines.text: Merritt, Forensics.

lines.speaker: u8914
lines.text: The teeth doin' any talkin'?

lines.speaker: u8908
lines.text: Ray.  Stop calling.  I told you the dental records will take time...

lines.speaker: u8914
lines.text: What about the blood?

lines.speaker: u8908
lines.text: Could be hers.  Types match.  Could be a lot of other people's too...

lines.speaker: u8914
lines.text: Second you get something on those teeth, I want it

lines.speaker: u8910
lines.text: I want a full-scale investigation.

lines.speaker: u8909
lines.text: You know what that will mean for Lombardo.

lines.speaker: u8910
lines.text: I don't care.  You heard that girl's statement.  I think he's dirty.  Get me a case.

lines.speaker: u8918
lines.text: He was my friend at first.  Then I got busted... he didn't even stick up for me.  I had to go away to that hellhole. It's like, you're his favorite, then who cares?  You wanna know something?  When Kelly said we should do this, I thought cool, all these big shots screwing me over, like that cop, Duquette.  Now they're gonna get screwed.

lines.speaker: u8910
lines.text: Your Honor... Please...

lines.speaker: u8914
lines.text: I say something funny?

lines.speaker: u8911
lines.text: No.  But I mean... just the idea that Mr. Lombardo would...

lines.speaker: u8914
lines.text: Way I hear it, he was pretty tight with the kids, one of the guys...

lines.speaker: u8911
lines.text: Yeah, but...

lines.speaker: u8912
lines.text: I'm running away.

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: You think that's wise?

lines.speaker: u8912
lines.text: Um-huh.  And guess what else?  I have toys.

lines.speaker: u8913
lines.text: Come on, let loose!

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: I was just thinking about where I'm gonna stay.  I lost the house.  It's like waking up from a goddamn nightmare.

lines.speaker: u8913
lines.text: You'll get over it. We've got a knockdown, airtight, motherfucker of a lawsuit against Sandra Van Ryan.

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: Just like that?

lines.speaker: u8913
lines.text: Just like that?  These people ruined your life, bro.

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: Jesus, man... You okay?

lines.speaker: u8914
lines.text: That how you planned it?  You take cut Suzie, get me to hang it on Kelly, then dump me in the ocean...

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: Come off it, man... It was an accident.

lines.speaker: u8917
lines.text: Grab a clue, Sam.  You're a hired hand around here.  Enjoy it while it lasts.

lines.speaker: u8916
lines.text: Goodbye, Sandra.

lines.speaker: u8919
lines.text: Time for you to get off, Ma'am.

lines.speaker: u8925
lines.text: Like hell!  I'll see it through! Ram the bastard!

lines.speaker: u8923
lines.text: You know, I really hate being toyed with before someone shoots me.

lines.speaker: u8920
lines.text: Fine, I'll stop.

lines.speaker: u8921
lines.text: Would you be thinking... ramming speed, sir?

lines.speaker: u8923
lines.text: I would, Mr. Doyle!  Are you game?

lines.speaker: u8923
lines.text: Where'd he say he was going to do this?

lines.speaker: u8922
lines.text: He didn't.  That's your job.  I'm taking you off that other case until you've nabbed this lunatic. Good luck.  Nice train.  But mine's nicer.

lines.speaker: u8927
lines.text: Hey...!

lines.speaker: u8923
lines.text: You're not going to use it, are you?

lines.speaker: u8927
lines.text: Well, come on, that's half a dozen armed men...

lines.speaker: u8923
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: u8931
lines.text: Thank you, friend.

lines.speaker: u8928
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.speaker: u8937
lines.text: They look like acorns.

lines.speaker: u8929
lines.text: Anything you hurl them at will turn to stone.

lines.speaker: u8930
lines.text: Go in the direction the bird is flying.

lines.speaker: u8937
lines.text: Oh, if I could do that I'd--I'd turn Burglekutt into a toad!

lines.speaker: u8930
lines.text: Waste magic on revenge?  You have much to learn, Willow...

lines.speaker: u8931
lines.text: I don't know, Willow.

lines.speaker: u8937
lines.text: Madmartigan, you promised me you'd take care of Elora Danan like your own daughter.  She is all that matters.  Are you going to abandon her?

lines.speaker: u8932
lines.text: I could be you rguard!  I could carry your spear!

lines.speaker: u8937
lines.text: What a great son you are, Ranon.  I wish I could take you with me.  Now go to sleep...

lines.speaker: u8933
lines.text: Patience, Willow.

lines.speaker: u8937
lines.text: Courage, Willow.

lines.speaker: u8936
lines.text: Get back here, Rool!

lines.speaker: u8934
lines.text: Ouch!  Let go of me!

lines.speaker: u8937
lines.text: She's hungry.

lines.speaker: u8935
lines.text: I know she's hungry.  I tried to feed her but she wouldn't eat a thing.  I'm not a wet nurse.

lines.speaker: u8937
lines.text: Here.  Hold her.

lines.speaker: u8937
lines.text: This can't be right.  This isn't a sorceress.  This is some kind of animal.

lines.speaker: u8936
lines.text: Queen Bavmorda transformed her.

lines.speaker: u8938
lines.text: Where I'm at is maybe 1890.

lines.speaker: u8939
lines.text: Say again?

lines.speaker: u8938
lines.text: Make that 1790.

lines.speaker: u8947
lines.text: Either you're a member of the club or you aren't, Elton.  Tell me what you know...

lines.speaker: u8939
lines.text: What I know, Paul, is...  He's going to take you out...

lines.speaker: u8940
lines.text: What's so funny?

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: Fred. The way he looked when you screamed at him.

lines.speaker: u8940
lines.text: God, Fred...

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: At home you'd never hear a woman scream at a man that way.

lines.speaker: u8940
lines.text: No? Why not?

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: You just wouldn't. It's not the Amish way.  But I think it would have done me good if I could have screamed at your brother last night.

lines.speaker: u8940
lines.text: Listen, I don't know what's going on or how you got mixed up with him, but don't you let that self-righteous son of a bitch push you around, okay?

lines.speaker: u8941
lines.text: No, Rachel...

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: I have to help him!

lines.speaker: u8943
lines.text: Never seen anything like that in all my years.

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: He's from... Ohio... My cousin.

lines.speaker: u8943
lines.text: We'll, them Ohio Amish sure must be different.  Our Lancaster brethren, they just don't have that kind of fight in them.

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: John, lost control of himself. He... will be repentant.

lines.speaker: u8943
lines.text: You're Rachel Lapp, aren't you?

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: Yes. Samuel! We're going.

lines.speaker: u8944
lines.text: He's not in this building.

lines.speaker: u8947
lines.text: All right, where is he?

lines.speaker: u8946
lines.text: I don't want to stay here.

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: They are English. They don't understand.

lines.speaker: u8946
lines.text: I wish dawdie was with us.

lines.speaker: u8945
lines.text: I know. Sleep now, Liebchen.

lines.speaker: u8952
lines.text: Look at you, Zeke -- you're just as white --

lines.speaker: u8948
lines.text: Here, here, what's all this jabber-wapping when there's work to be done?  I know three shiftless farm hands that'll be out of a job before they know it!

lines.speaker: u8952
lines.text: Well, Dorothy was walking along the --

lines.speaker: u8948
lines.text: I saw you tinkering with that contraption, Hickory. Now, you and Hunk get back to that wagon!

lines.speaker: u8952
lines.text: All right, Mrs. Gale.  But some day they're going to erect a statue to me in this town, and --

lines.speaker: u8948
lines.text: Well, don't start posing for it now.  Here, here -- can't work on an empty stomach. Have some crullers.

lines.speaker: u8955
lines.text: From now on you'll be history

lines.speaker: u8949
lines.text: You'll be hist...

lines.speaker: u8959
lines.text: No -- No -- No -- No!

lines.speaker: u8950
lines.text: Ohh!  OHH!  OHH!

lines.speaker: u8959
lines.text: Help! I'm burning!  I'm burning!  I'm burning!  Help! Help! Help!

lines.speaker: u8963
lines.text: You stay out of this, Glinda, or I'll fix you as well!

lines.speaker: u8951
lines.text: Oh, rubbish!  You have no power here. Be gone, before somebody drops a house on you, too.

lines.speaker: u8963
lines.text: Very well -- I'll bide my time -- and as for you, my fine lady, it's true, I can't attend to you here and now as I'd like, but just try to stay out of my way....

lines.speaker: u8960
lines.text: You don't get around us that easy!

lines.speaker: u8954
lines.text: Not nohow!

lines.speaker: u8956
lines.text: ... about Dorothy.

lines.speaker: u8962
lines.text: Dorothy?  Well, what has Dorothy done?

lines.speaker: u8956
lines.text: What's she done?  I'm all but lame from the bite on my leg!

lines.speaker: u8962
lines.text: You mean she bit you?

lines.speaker: u8956
lines.text: No, her dog!

lines.speaker: u8962
lines.text: Oh, she bit her dog, eh?

lines.speaker: u8956
lines.text: NO!

lines.speaker: u8957
lines.text: ...of the West.

lines.speaker: u8960
lines.text: B-B-B-B-B-But if we do that, we'll have to kill her to get it!

lines.speaker: u8959
lines.text: How can I ever thank you enough?

lines.speaker: u8964
lines.text: Well, you can't.  As for you, my fine friend -- you're a victim of disorganized thinking.  You are under the unfortunate delusion that simply because you run away from danger, you have no courage.  You're confusing courage with wisdom.  Back where I come from, we have men who are called heroes.  Once a year, they take their fortitude out of mothballs and parade it down the main street of the city.  And they have no more courage than you have.  But! They have one thing that you haven't got! A medal!  Therefore -- for meritorious....

lines.speaker: u8964
lines.text: -- Ruined my exit!

lines.speaker: u8960
lines.text: Help!

lines.speaker: u8974
lines.text: The Maidens Tower.

lines.speaker: u8965
lines.text: How appropriate.

lines.speaker: u8974
lines.text: Id heard there were some renovations there...no one would look for a sub in that place in a million years.

lines.speaker: u8974
lines.text: In the good old days, the KGB had three or four spots where our submarines could surface without anyone knowing. But Yevgeny is supposed to be loading cargo.

lines.speaker: u8966
lines.text: What class sub does your nephew run?

lines.speaker: u8974
lines.text: C-class.

lines.speaker: u8968
lines.text: Everythings under control up here.  Are you ready?

lines.speaker: u8971
lines.text: Yes.  Au revoir...

lines.speaker: u8970
lines.text: Any word from him?

lines.speaker: u8972
lines.text: Still no contact yet.

lines.speaker: u8975
lines.text: The access code's been changed.  Your card won't work anymore.

lines.speaker: u8985
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: u8975
lines.text: Please.

lines.speaker: u8976
lines.text: As you can see, we may be able to salvage a good-sized chunk of the farm belt.

lines.speaker: u8987
lines.text: What about the aftermath?  This so-called . . . "nuclear winter" theory?

lines.speaker: u8976
lines.text: We don't really know, sir, but bluntly, our survival capability . . . may depend on a quirk of the weather.

lines.speaker: u8987
lines.text: The weather.  I see.  Keep me posted.  I want hourly forecasts and a full report on optimum strike conditions.

lines.speaker: u8977
lines.text: He would -- You might as well know.  It's gonna get messy.  We got a call from Washington.

lines.speaker: u8981
lines.text: Washington?

lines.speaker: u8977
lines.text: They want in.  Seems our friend here was hardcore CTU.

lines.speaker: u8978
lines.text: That man, then, he was the first.  The first you --

lines.speaker: u8988
lines.text: Saw the world that night -- random, empty, hideous.  God didn't make it that way.  We did.  We make the world -- in our own image.  What else can I illuminate?

lines.speaker: u8985
lines.text: Jon --

lines.speaker: u8979
lines.text: Space and time.  I finally understand, Laurie.  I see it all now.

lines.speaker: u8985
lines.text: Jon -- for God¹s sake, what do you see?

lines.speaker: u8979
lines.text: I see what the watchmaker made.  I see the universe!

lines.speaker: u8988
lines.text: . . . And they call me a fucking nut.

lines.speaker: u8980
lines.text: Adrian.  It¹s too late.  The world is blowing up as we stand here.

lines.speaker: u8983
lines.text: I can fix it.

lines.speaker: u8982
lines.text: -- What?

lines.speaker: u8983
lines.text: My dad's a watchmaker.  I'll put it back together for you.  Better than ever.

lines.speaker: u8990
lines.text: No comment.

lines.speaker: u8984
lines.text: Did you know he was back on the streets?

lines.speaker: u8990
lines.text: I did not.  Now get out of my way!

lines.speaker: u8984
lines.text: Isn't it true that you --

lines.speaker: u8990
lines.text: Nasty cough.  -- Try one of mine.  Darling, you need to get out of the house.  Why don't you give Daniel a call?  I'm sure he'd be glad to hear from you.

lines.speaker: u8985
lines.text: Maybe I'll do that.

lines.speaker: u8990
lines.text: I'm sorry about Blake.

lines.speaker: u8988
lines.text: Two things I hate.  Street mimes . . . users of recreational drugs.

lines.speaker: u8986
lines.text: No, no.  You got it all wrong.  I been on the case, Rorschach, I got something for you.

lines.speaker: u8988
lines.text: Call off the cat and I'll kill you, Veidt.

lines.speaker: u8990
lines.text: Before you do that, you might want to look at what I've been looking at.

lines.speaker: u8995
lines.text: Alright, do what you want. But keep the screws on him. He's a wild card. That could be either good or bad.

lines.speaker: u8991
lines.text: So the odds are up to fifty-fifty? I can deal with that.

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: We're on to the game, ese. You got the fake blood splattered all over the walls, you got your torture tools... It's all very cute. But come on, let's quit while you're ahead. I'm only trying to save you a beatin'.

lines.speaker: u8992
lines.text: You saving me? You talking pretty tough for a guy got himself chained to the ceiling.

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: Alright. You wanna eat through a tube, be my guest.

lines.speaker: u8992
lines.text: Now you're gonna make me enjoy this, funny guy. Now I'm gonna take the whole foot off. Whatchu think of that?

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: Just about anything I want, it looks like. This is gonna be tough, though. There's no way to save this game. I gotta get it right the first time through.

lines.speaker: u8993
lines.text: What do you get if you finish?

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: Nothing, really. My guy is just doing it to stay alive.

lines.speaker: u8993
lines.text: Oh. I bet by the end he gets something out of it.

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: Like what?

lines.speaker: u8993
lines.text: He gets to be the hero.

lines.speaker: u8994
lines.text: The Peace conference...

lines.speaker: u9001
lines.text: Nice place to start, don't you think?

lines.speaker: u8996
lines.text: Now that I've given you the overview, we're going to spend the next couple hours going into extensive operational detail.

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: I thought that was in detail.

lines.speaker: u8997
lines.text: What...?

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: I was gonna wait till the islands, but...

lines.speaker: u8997
lines.text: You're serious?

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: Of course I'm serious. I bought it, didn't I?

lines.speaker: u8997
lines.text: This is so typical. I can't believe you. I've barely seen you for the last three weeks and now this? Are you out of your mind?

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: I don't know. I thought this is what you wanted. You want stability, here it is.

lines.speaker: u8997
lines.text: You can't just propose to me out of nowhere. You think that's going to solve our problems? I'm sorry, X. It was a kick for a while, but it's over. You're just not going anywhere.

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: You're not exactly "going anywhere" yourself.

lines.speaker: u8997
lines.text: You're wrong about that. I'm heading out that door right now.

lines.speaker: u8998
lines.text: Sorry, "dude".

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: What's the deal?

lines.speaker: u8998
lines.text: Oh come on, don't feel bad. You got played, so what? You're new at this. Did you think you could just stroll into this business one day and have all the angles figured out?

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: Why you dogging me up?

lines.speaker: u8998
lines.text: They came and found me. They said they'd kill me unless I help them. Plus they offer me a lot of money. No big deal. These things happen. Dump your gun on the floor.

lines.speaker: u8999
lines.text: They're all over the place! What the hell's going on?

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: Looks like we're in the middle of the drug war.

lines.speaker: u9001
lines.text: You both could have been a part of it. You could have ridden with us into a new day, the dawning of a new age of --

lines.speaker: u9000
lines.text: Oh just shoot us already. I'm sorry I asked.

lines.speaker: u9002
lines.text: Correct...  Apparently, Adamantium is the only metal strong enough to hold the energy this machine produces.  He used the Adamantium in Logan's dog tag to test it on the Senator.  And I assume now he plans to use the rest of Logan's skeleton for a larger demonstration.

lines.speaker: u9003
lines.text: For what purpose?

lines.speaker: u9002
lines.text: Yes -- Only there's a problem.  The mutator gene is not responding to the radiation the way it would in mother nature.  It's forcing the body's cells to replicate thousands of times faster than they're accustomed to.  The Senator's body is literally burning itself out.  Scott -- this machine kills people and I don't think Magneto realizes it.

lines.speaker: u9003
lines.text: So where do you think he's planning this larger demonstration?

lines.speaker: u9006
lines.text: I'm o.k.  I'm o.k.

lines.speaker: u9003
lines.text: Sure you are, sport.

lines.speaker: u9004
lines.text: The mutant gene tells the body when it needs to change.

lines.speaker: u9005
lines.text: I can assure you, there is no such creature in my genes.

lines.speaker: u9005
lines.text: What is it you intend to do to me?

lines.speaker: u9007
lines.text: Let's just say, God works too slowly.

lines.speaker: u9006
lines.text: Why is everybody up at sunrise?

lines.speaker: u9009
lines.text: The sun is setting, Logan.  You've been asleep for nineteen hours.

lines.speaker: u9006
lines.text: What did she do to me?

lines.speaker: u9009
lines.text: She borrowed your power to save her life.  When she touches someone, she absorbs their strengths -- their gifts.  In your case -- your ability to heal.  That's why she keeps her body covered.

lines.speaker: u9006
lines.text: I felt like she almost killed me.

lines.speaker: u9009
lines.text: If she held on any longer she could have.

lines.speaker: u9006
lines.text: And you think it helps calling her Rogue?

lines.speaker: u9007
lines.text: Doesn't it ever wake you in the middle of the night?  The feeling that some day, some day very soon, they will pass that foolish law - or one just like it - and they will come for you and your children?  Take you all away?

lines.speaker: u9010
lines.text: It does indeed, Max.

lines.speaker: u9007
lines.text: And what do you do when you wake up to that?

lines.speaker: u9010
lines.text: I feel a great swell of pity for the poor soul who comes to that school again looking for trouble.

lines.speaker: u9011
lines.text: Excuse me, Mr. Waldman -- excuse me for interrupting.  But is Frederick, then...a medical doctor?

lines.speaker: u9014
lines.text: Yes, my dear, he is.

lines.speaker: u9011
lines.text: And has he achieved...any special degree of eminence?

lines.speaker: u9014
lines.text: He is the fifth leading authority in his field.

lines.speaker: u9011
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.speaker: u9014
lines.text: Herr Falkstein -- you must go at once and present Dr. Frankenstein with all the details of his inheritance.  The estate will provide for your journey.

lines.speaker: u9017
lines.text: I think we all need a good night's sleep.  Why don't we meet next week and thrash this thing out?

lines.speaker: u9012
lines.text: Now wait a minute!

lines.speaker: u9017
lines.text: Carlson!

lines.speaker: u9013
lines.text: Yes, sir?

lines.speaker: u9017
lines.text: Bring me some surgical gauze, a little tape and some disinfectant.

lines.speaker: u9013
lines.text: Yes, sir.  Do you want the other cauliflower?

lines.speaker: u9014
lines.text: Herr Falkstein! You have your instructions!

lines.speaker: u9018
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.speaker: u9014
lines.text: I have taken an oath that each letter of this testament shall be executed...and by God, it shall be done!

lines.speaker: u9017
lines.text: Good night.

lines.speaker: u9015
lines.text: That's my good boy.

lines.speaker: u9017
lines.text: What are you waiting around for, pickle puss?

lines.speaker: u9016
lines.text: This wire came while you were gone. Your fiancee will be arriving any moment.

lines.speaker: u9017
lines.text: Elizabeth!?!  'Can't waits any longer.  Arrive in your arms at ten tonight.' Oh, God!  Not tonight.

lines.speaker: u9020
lines.text: Sweetheart.....Is this really you???

lines.speaker: u9017
lines.text: MMMMMMMMMMMMMMmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!

lines.speaker: u9019
lines.text: Another fifteen seconds to go.

lines.speaker: u9020
lines.text: Do Something!  Stall them!

lines.speaker: u9023
lines.text: Foooooood!

lines.speaker: u9021
lines.text: Now just one moment.  There's no need for roughhousing.  Have you ever tried a tip?

lines.speaker: u9023
lines.text: GRRRHMMNNNJKJMMMNN!

lines.speaker: u9021
lines.text: Franz!  Help!  Lunatic!

lines.text: Why don 't the Zulus attack?

lines.speaker: u9025
lines.text: Zulu may not wear shoes or trousers and the like but it don 't mean to say they got no brains. They'll watch us  and wait  and find our weaknesses.

lines.text: Splendid site, Crealock, splendil I want to establish Camp here immediately.

lines.speaker: u9028
lines.text: Choose your targets men. That's right Watch those markers. 55

lines.text: Keep steady. You're the best shots of the Twenty-Fourth. You bunch of heathens, do it

lines.speaker: u9034
lines.text: Well I assure you, Sir, I have no desire to create difficulties. 45

lines.speaker: u9030
lines.text: And I assure you, you do not In fact I'd be obliged for your best advice. What have your scouts seen?

lines.speaker: u9034
lines.text: So far only their scouts. But we have had reports of a small Impi farther north, over there.
